intro: Silene linicola, commonly known as the liny seedplant, is a flowering plant species native to the western United States. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, which includes many showy flowering plants. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as deserts and rocky soils. It produces small, pink to white flowers that bloom in the spring. Silene linicola is characterized by its slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves.
